intro: Sagenia intermedia, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Sagenia intermedia is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
